|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== Per the box... *The FCC ID of the card is KA2APC260PO (it's pictured on the card itself and it's also stated by the UPC). *"8EAISA01..C1-0" and "REV-C1" is silkscreened on the pictured card. **This text is similar to the board P/N format used by '''Alpha Networks''' (the company spun off from '''D-Link''''s former manufacturing division). This, combined with the fact that it is using a '''D-Link''' FCC ID, suggests it was indeed manufactured by '''D-Link''' (internal model EAISA-01 ??). *A MAC label with a 00:04:05 OUI is affixed to the pictured card. **The MAC label is stuck on top of the (single-chip) Ethernet controller. The box does, however, note that the card is NE2000 compatible.
Per an actual production model... *The FCC ID of the card / the one on the card is KA2APC260PO. *"8EAISA01.0D2" and "REV-D2" is silkscreened on the card. **"P/N", "181025183760", "9841M", and "BH6086.1" is the text on the Ethernet controller *A sticker reading "'''LINKSYS''' Ether16 LAN Card" is affixed to the top left of the board. *The serial number of the card is '''EGZ8B12428'''. *The unit's MAC address is, per its label (again, affixed to the Ethernet controller), 00:40:05:6E:AD:FF. *"MADE IN TAIWAN" is etched into the bottom layer of the card.
The copyright year on the box is 1997.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
